tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Value for money,Wait time,
review: Visited for my daughter who had recurring infection and had to be admitted for 5 days in a different hospital. The other hospital Dr had scared us very much regarding the blood report results, hence we went to Dr Adarsh for second opinion. Dr Adarsh heard the entire history patiently, explained us each of the previous diagnosis and set our expectations right about the healing process, he not only cleared the doubts in our mind about recurring infections, but also instilled confidence in us to not worry much about some particular blood report and focus on overall health than an isolated test result.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: My daughter was very sick and after three days we have to fly for Bengaluru to attend my sister in laws function. Medicine of Ranchi‚Äôs doctor was on but no improvement. At the day of flight, we decided to cancel our tour by looking at the deteriorating condition of our little princess. Then, one of my friends who lives in Bengaluru asked me to come and recommended me to Dr. Adarsh Someshekar at Ovum hospital. The day we landed we consulted immediately to Dr. Adarsh and came to know that she was suffering from acute infection of Tonsilitis. Treatment was started and believe me from the very next day my daughter started feeling better and better. After three days she started playing. We were so happy to see our princess getting better and healthy. I must thank Dr. Adarsh for his kind behavior and acumen to treat children. He is genuinely so good and calmly listens to your problem and gives ample amount of time needed to every patient. Moreover, the whole staff and nurses were so cooperative and the facilities at hospital is very good and systematic. For me, Dr. Adarsh is an angel and I don‚Äôt have enough words to thank him, so I wish him all the happiness, success and prosperity in his life. God bless him and his family.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: Doctor is very good in treatment and behavior. He treated my child very well. I will recommend this doctor for child treatment.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
We would highly recommend Dr. Adarsh Somashekar to anyone seeking excellent pediatric care.

His expertise in child care, knowledge and communication skills in particular were very impressive. 

He is also very thorough in examination, explanation of diagnosis and follow up care. We liked the fact that he creates a child friendly environment and is empathetic towards both the child and the parents. 

Overall we are very satisfied with the health improvement and positive outcome in the case of both my kids(aged 10 and 6) under this doctor's care.

tags: None
review: We have been visiting Dr Adarsh for my elder son since last year and now consulting for our new born too. It is always relieving after visiting doctor Adarsh. He is extremely compassionate. We were surprised by the way he makes us realise few things which we might have underconsidered as a parent. It is very kind of him to suggest home remedies which is an added advantage. I highly recommend Dr Adarsh for any parent looking for top-notch pediatric care.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: I know Dr. Adarsh from 2008 (from my first son's birth onwards) and he is only pediatrician for my two sons. He is so down to earth and reachable. You can trust him. Till this 10 years in Bangalore i never came to a doc  who really thinks on parent shoes.  He always comfort the kids and he has an art of making them calm. He explains the health condition, why it caused, and how can be solved. He give special attention especially while giving injection or vaccination. He never leaves the kids with nurses like other doc do. My ten years of experience, you can trust him. I recommend him 100%.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: Dr Adarsh has been seeing my little one since she was a new born, had heard rave reviews about Dr Adarsh from my relatives  .. it‚Äôs been close to 1 year and 7 months now and been a pure delight to have come across a paediatrician who is so well versed in his craft , well spoken ,  ************ *takes time to pass on the science behind the diagnosis along with much needed tidbits of advice to parents  ,there have been times when we have had to rush our daughter in when she was  unwell only to be put at ease by Dr Adarsh , always maintains his composure, always smiling puts the parents at ease .. arguably one of the best Doctors in town , I am glad my daughters health is in safe hands .. recently my friends daughter too was diagnosed with kidney stones and was treated by Dr Adarsh , he too spoke highly of him and seemed quite pleased with  Dr Adarsh, highly recommend Dr Adarsh as your go to Paediatrician for your little munchkins.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
Well I visited the hospital for my baby's vaccination... I was happy that they were following the norms set by the govt but I wanted to give a few pointers for improving the arrangements during the corona crisis...
1) as vaccinations can be given over a period of 2 weeks do give appointments so that over crowding can be avoided... 
2) do not over burden the doctors by keeping walk ins
3) go digital..  filling forms and carrying files can be avoided
4) as ventilation is centralised ac , if patients want to stay in their car allow them

tags: Value for money,Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: Our association with Dr. Adarsh Someshekar started in 2012 when he was practising at Indira Nagar. He explains health issues with its reasons and ways to avoid or control it. We are impressed with his clinical skill with which he diagnoses the health issues precisely without the need of multiple rounds. His prescriptions are less medicine and more practices we need to follow. He is particular in administering vaccination to children by himself. A passionate paediatrician we can depend upon.  Our special thanks for the treatments for nonstop cough, scalp infection (Impetigo on scalp) which worried us a lot but you treated quite fast.

Any opinion or suggestions required even for us also only one name comes to our mind Dr.Adarsh Somashekar.
He is very friendly with lot of patience and best part is he is a very good human being.
Thank you so much sir all your help all these years.

tags: Explanation of the health issue,
review:
We are first time parents and the doctor didn‚Äôt explain anything about the 6w vaccination. He just went ahead and gave our baby vaccines. And just told us our baby won‚Äôt fall sick and will be fine. She cried all night and we had to rush to the emergency at 12.30am because we weren‚Äôt told what to expect.

But what made me really angry was when I asked what I can do to pacify my baby because our baby was crying non stop, this were his exact words : ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs the extreme that can happen, she‚Äôll cry, maybe turn blue, maybe go unconscious for a while and wake up again‚Äù. How insensitive and rude is that! My baby is 6 weeks old!

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
context: Newborn Jaundice,Paediatric & Family Counselling,Consultation provided for newborns ,
review:
I recently visited the doctor for general consultation of my new born baby and being first time mom I had few concerns which I wanted to discuss. Below are my feedback:
1. Firstly, he picked up his call and was busy on it while we were in his chamber and were discussing on my concerns. The doctor made us wait and my baby was crying while he was busy on his call for more than 10 mints. He didn't even apologise which is very unprofessional.
2. When I told my concerns, he was least interested and did not have patience to listen completely. He behaved very rudely and somehow wanted to finish and get away. Due to his behavior I could not ask much of questions which I had. The consultation charges for 550 rs and he did not even spent 5 minutes. 
3. I went 2 times for consultation and both the times he was in a hurry. He does not sit and explain anything properly. I am not going to him again and already consulting a different doctor.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: Visited the doctor since my baby was feeling unwell due to cold and cough... the doctor made us wait and did not even apologise for making us wait which was very unprofessional.... just like the doctor all of us are busy and professionals in our own lives.... he did not have the patience to listen what i was saying.... he wanted to finish the consultation soon and get away... he just checked the heartbeat and did not examine fully nor see the previous history reports like the doctors did in my previous visits else where....he was least interested....i ask for a doubt and he says its automated u will get the report.... he seemed rude and very unsatisfying consultation.... i am from london too where he practiced but they are more friendly and take time to listen to us and dont show us attitude.. we go to doctor for help and they treat us very badly as if we are getting consultation for free of cost. I hope he takes time to listen and answer queries with patience
